title: util: cli: FastChildWatcher is not compatible with windows machine.
body:
## Describe the bug

I installed the package on windows 10 (python is installed using anaconda), and wanted to run the first example in the [Quick Start](https://intel.github.io/dffml/quickstart/model.html) page. However, it crashed. 

## Steps To Reproduce

Install dffml on a windows machine and run:

```
cat > training.csv << EOF
Years,Expertise,Trust,Salary
0,1,0.1,10
1,3,0.2,20
2,5,0.3,30
3,7,0.4,40
EOF

cat > test.csv << EOF
Years,Expertise,Trust,Salary
4,9,0.5,50
5,11,0.6,60
EOF

cat > predict.csv << EOF
Years,Expertise,Trust
6,13,0.7
7,15,0.8
EOF

dffml train \
  -model scikitlr \
  -model-features Years:int:1 Expertise:int:1 Trust:float:1 \
  -model-predict Salary:float:1 \
  -sources f=csv \
  -source-filename training.csv
```


## Expected behavior

I was expecting to train a model without crashing. 

## Logs or Screenshots

I received the following error: 

```
Traceback (most recent call last):                                              
  File "d:\programs\anaconda\envs\python37\lib\runpy.py", line 193, in _run_modu
le_as_main                                                                      
    "__main__", mod_spec)                                                       
  File "d:\programs\anaconda\envs\python37\lib\runpy.py", line 85, in _run_code 
    exec(code, run_globals)                                                     
  File "D:\programs\anaconda\envs\python37\Scripts\dffml.exe\__main__.py", line 
7, in                                                                   
  File "d:\programs\anaconda\envs\python37\lib\site-packages\dffml\util\cli\cmd.
py", line 206, in main                                                          
    watcher = asyncio.FastChildWatcher()                                        
AttributeError: module 'asyncio' has no attribute 'FastChildWatcher'
```

## Packages in use and versions
Python version is 3.7.6; and here is the return of pip freeze:

```
absl-py==0.9.0
aiohttp==3.6.2
aiohttp-cors==0.7.0
aiomysql==0.0.20
astor==0.8.1

dffml-model-scikit==0.0.7
dffml-model-scratch==0.0.6

PyMySQL==0.9.2

tensorboard==2.1.1
tensorflow==2.1.0
tensorflow-estimator==2.1.0
termcolor==1.1.0
urllib3==1.25.8
Werkzeug==1.0.0
wincertstore==0.2
wrapt==1.12.1
yarl==1.4.2
```

## Misc Notes
I did the same steps with Ubuntu 18.04.4 LTS, and ran successfully. It seems `asyncio.FastChildWatcher()` is not compatible with windows.
